profound.translation[0].definitions[0].d: having a strong influence or effect
profound.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Tolstoy’s experiences of war had a profound effect on his work.
The mother’s behaviour has a profound impact on the developing child.
profound.translation[0].definitions[3].d: deep or far below the surface of something
profound.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Her work touches something profound in the human psyche.
